dialogues.text: Sit down. The mother and boy sit on the ground in the corner by the and_ bury their faces into each other, making themselves small as possible. * Desperate, Luke looks out the window. It would be a long to the ground. He opens the window. He starts to climb * through, His leg is in pain and hard to move. HEARS Avery downstairs calling, "POLICE! DROP YOUR WEAPON!" He is cornered.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aw, hell. Do you have a phone? The mother nods, tells him it's on the nightstand. He pic up the phone, dials information.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Schenectady. Her name is Romina.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Guitierrez... I think... * While the operator checks, he sits down on the window sil

dialogues.text: sets his gun down between his legs.  84 85 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 34.

dialogues.text: I have a Romina Guitierrez on Brandywine. I have the number. Would you like me to connect you?

dialogues.text: Yes! Connect me! The phone rings. Luke swings one leg out the window, but can barely move it. He can’t jump out.

dialogues.text: Please answer. He hears the cop outside his door. CLICK. The phone picks up.

dialogues.speaker: ROMINA, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Romina? Avery hears Luke’s voice. Weapon aimed, he bursts through bedroom door, sees Luke with the phone in one hand, and h body halfway out the window. He shoots. The shot makes a loud, sharp noise. A small cloud of blue smoke rises from muzzle and floats toward the ceiling. Luke is hit in the abdomen, he drops the phone. Avery see it, lowers his gun, thinks, “did I just shoot a man with phone in his hand?" Luke looks down at the blood spreading through the fabric his shirt. He grabs the gun on the sill, shoots back: hits Avery in knee. The kickback from the gun pushes Luke's body back a he falls out the window like a rag doll: ass over teakett

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 87 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 35. Avery clutches his leg; agony. FUCK! Avery tries to get himself up off the floor. He can't. His knee is destroyed

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (INTO RADIO)
dialogues.text: ADAM-22. Officer down. Suspect escaped through window. Request paramedics and backup at the scene. The young mother grabs her son, shields his eyes from the carnage, and bolts out of the room. Avery is left alone. He stares at the window. Blood splat on the wall. A curtain blows gently in the breeze. He can hear ROMINA’s VOICE screaming, oeitakel” out of the speak the phone. He crawls to the window using his 3 functional limbs; Sir in the distance. He uses his arms to prop himself up on t window; SEES; Luke splayed out on his back on the ground below. His body is contorted in an impossible awkward position. A pool of blood forms around his head. It is a nightmarish image. Cop cars and ambulances descend on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery lies on a moving gurney. His pant-leg is being cut from his skin. A nurse sedates him. A DOCTOR explains.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: We're giving g you a mild sedative now and saline for shock, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ER staff rolls Avery into the operating theater. Anot team in there already frantically works on Luke. Avery hears Luke's heart monitor beep erratically. He wat the doctors act more frantically. Finally, the heart moni emits a flat, even tone. The sound of screaming. Avery looks and sees Romina waili and fighting with ER staff. Kofi helps to restrain her. An INTERN straddles Luke and starts to give him CPR. A nu closes a curtain around Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Officer? We need to operate now. Behind the curtain, the other team tries to shock Luke's heart back to life before the SURGEON finally gives up.

dialogues.speaker: SURGEON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Time of death four thirty-nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 36.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR
dialogues.text: (To Avery) Don't be afraid. An anesthesiologist fits a mask over Avery's mouth and no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balloons, flowers & cards fill Avery 's room. CHIEF GORDO WEIRZBOWSKI, 50's, enters the room followed by DA BILL KILLCULLEN, mid-40's. Both are reverent and respectful. They greet Avery, who is lying in bed. His father AL, lat 60's is there, along with his wife JENNIFER, 27, who hold Avery's baby boy A.J. Gordon kisses Jennifer and offers h understanding.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: How's our hero?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: I don't know. She squeezes Avery's hand.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: No more than a scratch really.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: Your Honor. Pleasure... I believe you two know each other... Killcullen comes in to shake Al's hand.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Of course, Bill. Nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: We miss you at the court house.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Well, I hate to break it to you, but I don't miss you (he he). Swinging that gavel was starting to interfere with my golf game. Little laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: Whatdaya think - with Avery, injured, and you out of work, maybe you'd consider joining the force. We could use a good man.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you're only recruiting one from this family.  PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 37.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: (to Avery) They give you any idea when you might get outta here?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Can't be soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: (to Al) Boy's got ambition. Give him that.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: That's one word for it. (to Jennifer We better be taking you home. He takes Jennifer's hand and leads her out.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: We'll take care of your husband. Don't you worry Jenny. Weirzbowski kisses A.J.'s little hand, then Jennifer's ch

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: (to Avery) Are you going to be Okay?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Yeah. You guys go. They leave. Gordon pulls up a chair next to Avery's bed. Killcullen stands.

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: How's the knee?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Fucked.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: It'll heal. You're young. Young body bounces back. I want to introduce you to Bill Killcullen, Schenectady DA. Bill needs to ask you some questions. You up for it? Good to do it before the paint dries, know-whatimean?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: So you're effectively putting me on trial?

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: Mister sensitive... Don't get your panties in a bind. You're gonna be our poster boy. This is a formality. Best get it outta the way.  89

dialogues.speaker: PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11
dialogues.text: Weirzbowski puts his hat on, gets up to leave. CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI (CONT’D) I'll leave you two to get to know each other. Shouldn't be too hard. You both speak lawyer talk. INT. HOSPITAL RECOVERY ROOM- ELLIPSE. ghey are deep into Avery's recounting of the events. Kille

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: So what happened when you were outside the door?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: I heard him on the other side. Sounded like he was talking on the phone. But I couldn't tell who he was talking to. So, I made my presence known.

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: How'd you do that.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: (piecing it together) Announced myself. "Police. Drop the weapon." And when he didn't respond. I kicked the door’ open... and I saw him sitting on the ledge of the window with... he was holding a phone...

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: ... and he had a gun?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Yeah... (deep sigh) .-.I saw him drop the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: And when did he fire?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: After he dropped the phone...

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: And then you returned fire?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: ...Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: And then he fell out the window? Avery nods. 38. 89 ullen records everything on tape deck and jots notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 39.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KILLCULLEN
dialogues.text: Good riddance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TV: A local NEWS ANCHOR sits at her studio desk.

dialogues.speaker: NEWS ANCHOR, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: A triumphant moment for a young Schenectady Police officer today. He left the hospital after recovering from gunshot wounds. ON TV: Footage of the day Avery shot Luke. NEWS ANCHOR gon T.V.) (CONT'D) Officer Avery Cross hadn't been on the force for a full year before he ran head-on into the alleged MOTOBANDIT. Reporter Ed Dague was there as officer Cross left Ellis hospital. ON TV: Avery is wheeled out of the hospital. Dozens of co stand around and cheer him as he rolls past & pumps his f

dialogues.speaker: ED DAGUE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Facing the danger and fighting the brave fight, Avery Cross accepting the praise Of his fellow officers as he is wheeled through a gauntlet of cheers and apprause- Turning a corner in his recover he's leaving Ellis hospita well enough to return home - happy "to be alive. ON TV: Cops lift his wheelchair into an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: I'll be back before you know it. ON TV: File footage from the day of the shooting.

dialogues.speaker: ED DAGUE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This young officer's life flashed before him in a flash of gunfire. Responding to a bank robbery, Avery Cross pursued alleged motor-cycle bandit Luke Glanton through the streets of Schenectady. Avery sits on a sofa in his comfortable but not fancy hom his leg elevated in a cast. Jennifer sits next to him try to calm A.J.  PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 40.

dialogues.speaker: ED DAGUE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Glanton then fled into this house, took Melissa Majack & her son Gabe hostage, & came face to face with Officer Cross. Glanton shot Officer Cross in the knee before officer Cross returned fire, killing the suspect and saving the hostages. ON TV: DAGUE stands in front of the hospital, holding a m

dialogues.speaker: ED DAGUE, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: Officer Cross was rushed here to Ellis hospital and listed in critical condition. He has made a swift recovery, but doctors say the bullet that struck him has caused nerve damage in his leg. ON TV: Police CHIEF GORDON WEIRZBOWSKI, 50's greying, fireplug, talks to the reporters at the scene.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: He's a hero. Plain and simple. There's one thing he wants to do more than anything else; that's slide behind the wheel of a radio car and go back out there and do the same thing he was doing that day. Hopefully with better results. ON TV: Avery sits on the same couch he is sitting on as h watches himself on TV.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: I've only ever wanted to be a cop. Ever since I was six. The baby's cries drown out the TV. Jennifer stands, tryin calm him down by bouncing. Jennifer doesn't look so calm herself. Avery turns up the volume.

dialogues.speaker: ED DAGUE, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: We talked with Officer Cross for a moment about the high crime rate in Schenectady.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: It's an epidemic. And it's up to the police to do the heavy lifting. That's our job. But also something the community has to help with. ED DAGUE (ON Tv) We also asked Cross how he feels about ongoing allegations of corruption dogging the police.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (ON T.V.)
dialogues.text: Schenectady deserves better.  91 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 41. A.J. Is wailing. Avery is numb to it. Jennifer can't take more. She retreats with the baby to their bedroom. ON TV: Luke's mug-shot.

dialogues.speaker: ED DAGUE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Glanton, a drifter and sometime motor-cycle stunt-rider, had a violent history and a long re record. Police say he moved here las spring and it only took him 5 month to start robbing local banks. He leaves behind a infant son. I'm Ed Dague, WNYT, Schenectady. A commercial begins on TV. Avery is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.J. sleeps in a crib in the corner of a small bedroom. A and Jennifer talk softly, lying in bed next to one anothe

dialogues.text: Was it scary?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: It happened so fast. Wasn't time to be scared.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: It's scary for me.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: I oust can't really believe that re dealing with this you know? Te! s just so weird...

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: What do you mean weird?

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: I guess the fact that you're in this position. I just never imagined our life like this.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Yeah well it's just part of the job unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: Haven't you had enough, now? Avery sees tears welling in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean there's so many things you could do.  92 93 94 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 42.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Why are you making me feel like I'm doing something wrong? I'm a cop. And_I don't know why I have to apologize for that.

dialogues.speaker: _ JENNIFER
dialogues.text: We are just worried about you...

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Who's "we?"

dialogues.speaker: JENNIFER
dialogues.text: I talked to your dad today...

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus Christ. Leave him OUT of it Jenny. He made his decisions and now I'm making mine. OK. Avery turns away from Jennifer. She looks at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONTAGE. Physical therapy - Avery literally learns to wal over again. We HEAR the doctor's prognosis over these ima

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You're going to be extremely weak on this leg for a while, so don't push too far too fast.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How long before I'm back to normal?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'd rather not give you any unrealistic expectations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the SHOWER RUNS in the background. Baby A.J. irresistibly cute, plays on a blanket, cooing. Avery sits the floor, Yegs set wide apart. He doesn't look at his so doesn't want to. His mind is somewhere else completely. T doorbell rings. Avery gets up to answer it. It is Scott. scoTtT Hey partner. We thought you might like’ a little distraction. Avery looks past Scott, sees PAUL DELUCA and his partner CROTTY idling in a cruiser out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery and Scott ride in the back. DeLuca and Crotty up fr  95 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 43.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: You are aware I'm not back on active duty yet. PAUL DELUCA ; We're aware. This is our gift to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery and Scott stand at the base of the steps and watch Deluca and Crotty ring the bell to Romina's house. Malena opens the door. DeLuca flashes his badge.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: Is Romina Gutierrez at home? Malena turns her head into the house.

dialogues.speaker: MALENA
dialogues.text: Romina! Kofi and Romina come to the door. Avery recognizes her fr the hospital. Deluca flashes his badge.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, ma'am. We're here to search the house.

dialogues.speaker: ROMINA
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: Evidence.

dialogues.speaker: KOFI
dialogues.text: Evidence for what?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: We're looking for the money Luke Glanton may or may not have given to you.

dialogues.speaker: ROMINA
dialogues.text: You supposed to have a warrant or something, right? DeLuca leans in close to Romina, quietly.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: How about you assume I have a warrant, and I assume she has a green card. Deluca nods toward Malena. Romina is out-manoeuvered. She lets them in. DeLuca nods to Scott and Avery to head upstairs. Avery reluctantly enters. Romina recognizes him from TV.  96 97

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for your loss. Romina feels violated by his presence. Avery side-steps around her, nodding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aided by a cane, Avery follows Scott as he heads into the first room on the left. They speak in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: I don't think I like this. ScoTT We're safe. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeLuca and Crotty sit across from Kofi and Romina. Malena brings out coffee and Hostess donuts.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma'am. (to Romina) Mostly this is just a formality. I believe you when you tell me you don't have the money, I really do.

dialogues.speaker: KOFI
dialogues.text: (To Romina) Don't say anything 'til we got a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: Relax, pal. You're not under arrest yet. Nothing you say matters.

dialogues.speaker: ROMINA
dialogues.text: We don't got the money.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: This guy was a real piker. 10G from this bank, 7 from that one. To them it's peanuts. It's all covered by the FDIC anyways.

dialogues.speaker: ROMINA
dialogues.text: He offered us the money but we never took it.

dialogues.speaker: KOFI
dialogues.text: Romina.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: It's okay, really. It's my boss see, the chief. He's very concerned about appearances. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: otta harass good people so he 80 s like he's doing his job. It's all politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott and Avery search Jason's room quietly. Scott begins lift the crib mattress.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: Hold the baby.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: This is too much. scoTtrT Come on. I don't wanna wake him. Avery picks up Jason, stares at his little, sleeping body contemplates the fact that he killed this kids father. Meanwhile, Scott lifts the mattress.

dialogues.speaker: . SCOTT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bingo. He pulls out_a stack of cash, shows it to Avery, hides it his person. Avery rests Jason back into the crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery and Scott come down the stairs. Scott approaches DeLuca, whispers in his ear. DeLuca smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery, Scott and Crotty wait in the car, WATCHING. Romina Kofi see them off from the porch. DeLuca is the last to leave. He lingers for a second on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: I gave you my card, right? If you remember anything regarding that money, you call me first, OK?

dialogues.speaker: KOFI
dialogues.text: Of course. Have a good evening officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DeLuca climbs into the car and drives off. Avery watches Romina and Kofi head back inside.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: So, what's our haul?  PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 46. Scott produces the money and all the cops except Avery ho Scott starts to flip through the bills.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where'd you find it? scoTtT Under the fucking crib.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: Ha! Perfect. scoTrT When do you think they'll notice it's missing?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: They're noticing it right now. Crotty grabs the bills from Scott.

dialogues.speaker: CROTTY
dialogues.text: You're too young to count. ScoTtT It's over fourteen grand!

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA
dialogues.text: It's not gonna be an even split. The lion's share is going to you. DeLuca looks at Avery in his rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL DELUCA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A little unofficial hazard pay. Crotty counts out the money. He gives a little of it to S and a lot of it to Avery. sScoTtT Thank you! Avery is slow to say something as he is handed the money.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Wow. DeLuca stares at him in the rearview. Avery can't meet hi gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery puts the money in an old shoe box and stashes it somewhere in the shed. Jennifer stands in the upstairs window. She sees him come of the shed and turn off the light.  103 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 47.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I know you're probably feeling a little disoriented by all that has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORY GILBEAU, 37 female police psychologist interviews Av Cory nods.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: I'm here to start a conversation with you. And although I will ultimately make a recommendation as to whether you're ready or not to return to duty. I want you to know that the details of what we discuss together will never move beyond these walls. OK?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: OK. So how are you Avery?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: OK. Other than my knee, I'm OK. CORY ; What are the doctors saying about your knee?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: I'll never be able to bend it properly. But that's just what it is.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: That doesn't bother you?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: I haven't had much time to think about it yet.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What have you been thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Since the shooting?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well... you know... it's just been such a crazy time with physical therapy and everything you know... getting everything back on track.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What do you have to get on track?  PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 48.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Everything. Cory waits for him to elaborate.

dialogues.speaker: AVERY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean like the job and relearning to walk and everything at home.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What do you mean ‘everything at home?'

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Well you know it's a shock for my wife and it doesn't help that there's a baby around but it's OK.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You say it doesn't help that there's a baby around...

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Well I just mean that it's just another thing you know? I think I just need time to get everything else sorted out first.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: First before what?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Before I can deal with that I guess..

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: You mean before you can deal with your baby? Avery doesn't respond. Cory waits.

dialogues.speaker: CORY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened Avery? Is this hard to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: . AVERY
dialogues.text: It's just been hard I guess.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: Hard to what?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: Hard to look at him. I can't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: CORY
dialogues.text: What about your wife? Are you having the same problems with her?

dialogues.speaker: AVERY
dialogues.text: .-.-I'm having a hard time...  104 105 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 49. He looks at her after he says it. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We are gathered here today to celebrate a cop who makes other cops proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avery, propped up by a cane, is in uniform for the first in weeks. He stands on stage at Proctor's Theater. His da Jennifer and A.J. sit in the audience 2nd with members of the community and reporters. Local news videotapes it. Ch Weirzbowski, in his best dress uniform, grips a podium.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI
dialogues.text: -.-Officer Avery Cross. We can all rest a little easier at night now that he's on the path of recovery. The crowd spontaneously applauds.

dialogues.speaker: CHIEF WEIRZBOWSKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Officer Cross is the first member of his family to join the force. And not just any force. He joined the Schenectady Police Department. He said he wanted to go where the action was. Well, careful what you wish for, right? Gordon beams and the audience laughs. Gordon lumbers over Avery and officially affixes a decoration on Avery's unif MOMENTS LATER. Photo ops. dialogues.text: Jason walks slowly up the driveway to Robin's service station. His new clothes and messed up face give him the of a completely different person. He walks into the front office, looks around. It's empty. Jason notices a long hallway leading to the back of the station. Jason walks down it slowly, comes to a half open loor. Through the door, Jason sees Robin. Robin stares with dee concentration at his computer. Jason stands and stares at until he suddenly looks up, startled by the sight of Jaso He pushes himself back in a protective instinct.

dialogues.text: (hesitates) You insinuating something son? Jason pulls out the revolver. He doesn't point it at Robi he just shows it to him. ROBIN (CONT’D Decided to grow a pair did ya? You putting the old misty eyed kid away and jumping into the man act? Jason can't bring himself to point the gun at Robin. Robi sniffs his weakness.

dialogues.text: Oh, I get it now. This is where you come to settle your old man's score. Well, you got the wrong guy. I stupidly tried to help that sorry sonofabitch. If it weren't for me he would've been living in the Y and giving blow jobs at the bus station for a living. Robin laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ROBIN, (CONT'D)

Put that away before you hurt yourself. Chickenshit. Jason lowers the gun. He wishes he never came in here. Ro stands, approaches him.  200 201 202 203 PINES WHITE SCRIPT AS OF 6/14/11 105.

And I'm thinkin' - what a Goddamn tragedy. Jason is frozen. ROBIN (CONT’D) You want a little piece of advice? Put that gun to good use. Stick the barrel in your mouth, pull the trigger. Robin turns his back on Jason. ROBIN (CONT’ D) Because listen - (FP you're too pussy to do it... I can certainly arrange a meeting between you and your dad. Jason scared now.
